name: CT scan
description: CT scans provide different views and far greater detail than a 2-dimensional x-ray. They may be used instead of an x-ray when your doctor needs to see soft tissues in your body

name: Electrocardiogram(ECG)
description: An electrocardiogram (ECG) is a medical test that detects cardiac abnormalities by measuring the electrical activity generated by the heart as it contracts.

name: MRI
description: Magnetic resonance imaging is a type of scan that uses strong magnetic fields and radio waves to produce detailed images of the inside of the body. MRI scanner is a large tube that contains magnets.

name: Blood Sugar test
description: Blood sugar test is one of the most common diagnostic tests for type 1 and type 2 diabetes. Type 1 diabetes is the rarer between the two and is also known as insulin dependent diabetics

name: X-RAY
description: X-rays are a type of radiation called electromagnetic waves. X-ray imaging creates pictures of the inside of your body. The images show the parts of your body in different shades of black and white.

name: Eye tests
description: you can get your eyes tested by an optometrist. Your GP can also check your eyes and vision and may suggest you see an optometrist or give you a referral

name: HEAR-TEST
description: The results of these tests are marked on a graph called an audiogram. Your audiologist can talk to you about whether or not you have a problem,

name: CBC
description: A complete blood count, also known as a full blood count, is a set of medical laboratory tests that provide information about the cells in a person's blood.

name: CRP
description: A blood test performed to know the amount of CRP component within the body. A CRP test is prescribed to detect infection, arthritis problems, kidney troubles and pancreatic issues.
